this is a great way to help people who are beyond needing simple handouts, and to enable the receiver to better their lives, and often their community's life.

Matthew 22: 34-40

Hearing that Jesus had silenced the Sadducees, the Pharisees got together. One of them, an expert in the law, tested him with this question: “Teacher, which is the greatest commandment in the Law?”
Jesus replied: “‘Love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your mind.’ This is the first and greatest commandment. And the second is like it: ‘Love your neighbor as yourself.’ All the Law and the Prophets hang on these two commandments.”

lenders.name: Mark
lenders.loan_because:
Because I can.  Heard that before?  Probably because that's why *lots* of us do this.  By "world standards" I am a wealthy guy.  I have a job, enough to eat, safe water to drink and a home that is safe and warm.  And no one is blowing things up in my neighborhood.  

More people deserve to live like this and maybe I can help that.
lenders.occupational_info: I play jazz.  I am a drummer (or percussionist, depending on who is paying me!) and I love to play bebop.

lenders.name: Lindsey
lenders.loan_because: I believe in the butterfly effect, when applied to human agency. Giving even one dollar to one person across the world can have an impact on the lives of everyone around them, and around me. We claim to be a country of Christian values, but when it comes to some of the most simple values, charity and kindness, we all seem to fall apart. I want to prove that even the non-Christian among us can uphold these values and make the world better.

Abraham Lincoln

lenders.name: Janet
lenders.loan_because:
My Grandfather once said, “It’s hard to pull yourself up by your bootstraps when you have no boots.”  

My Grandmother always had a little garden in her back yard.  During the Great Depression, to make extra money, people would stop to buy and pick their own vegetables. One day, as a little girl, my Mother remembers sitting on the back stoop with my Grandmother when a lady stopped to buy a “dime’s worth”.  My Grandmother handed her a paper sack and the lady set off to pick her vegetables.  My Mother then asked, “How do you know she won’t pick more than a dime’s worth?”  My Grandmother simply replied, “She knows how much she needs.”

I hope by being just one of the many loaning "boots", people everywhere will be able to pull themselves up by their bootstraps.

lenders.name: Donna-Lynne
lenders.loan_because:
Microloans are a proven path to self–sufficiency. 
Unlike big banks, Kiva loans create wealth by providing small loans to people who have good ideas but no access to money. Since Kiva loans have good track record for repayment, my money gets recycled - creating opportunities to ever more people.
lenders.occupational_info:
I focus my volunteer efforts to help marginalized women because I believe that is the best way to effect social change.  
When women are economically empowered (i.e. have their own money), their children are more likely to be educated and healthy. As these children move out of poverty, they are able to improve the overall economic and social health of their communities.

lenders.name: Laura
lenders.loan_because: I like having the opportunity to make a difference in the world by assisting individuals to support their families and make their world a better place.

lenders.name: Omni Job Boards
lenders.loan_because: Our aim is to deliver the highest quality for best possible value. We see that Kiva strives to to reach the same goal and shares our desire to connect people to help reach their full potential.
lenders.occupational_info: The Omni Job Board Network is a totally new concept in niche job board advertising.  Our aim is to deliver the best selection of high quality candidates available, thereby offering the best possible value for your recruitment advertising dollar.  A single job listed with Omni can be distributed across large number of affiliated job boards targeting job seekers in YOUR industry in YOUR location.
